org.ardenus.input.controller.keyboard

Class KeyboardController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ardenus.input.controller.Controller
      • org.ardenus.input.controller.keyboard.KeyboardController

  • public class KeyboardController
extends Controller
    A keyboard and mouse that can be used for input.
    Author:
    Trent "Whirvis" Summerlin

        Sets all of the keys on the keyboard color based on the specified bitmap.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - the bitmap.
        gKeys - the colors that should be set for the G keys. The order of the keys goes: KEY_ORION_G1, KEY_ORION_G2, KEY_ORION_G3, KEY_ORION_G4, KEY_ORION_G5, KEY_ORION_G6, KEY_ORION_G9, KEY_ORION_G8, KEY_ORION_LOGO, and KEY_ORION_BADGE

      • setKeyboardColor

        @OrionMethod
public static void setKeyboardColor(byte[] bitmap,
                                                  int... gKeys)
        Sets all of the keys on the keyboard color based on the specified bitmap.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - the bitmap.
        gKeys - the colors that should be set for the G keys. The order of the keys goes: KEY_ORION_G1, KEY_ORION_G2, KEY_ORION_G3, KEY_ORION_G4, KEY_ORION_G5, KEY_ORION_G6, KEY_ORION_G9, KEY_ORION_G8, KEY_ORION_LOGO, and KEY_ORION_BADGE

      • setKeyboardColor

        @OrionMethod
public static void setKeyboardColor(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                                  java.awt.Color... gKeys)
        Sets all of the keys on the keyboard color based on the specified image. This image should be used sparingly, as converting a BufferedImage to its scaled counterpart is very cost performant. This should only be called if you want to set the keyboard color based on an image rarely.
        Parameters:
        image - the image.
        gKeys - the colors that should be set for the G keys. The order of the keys goes: KEY_ORION_G1, KEY_ORION_G2, KEY_ORION_G3, KEY_ORION_G4, KEY_ORION_G5, KEY_ORION_G6, KEY_ORION_G9, KEY_ORION_G8, KEY_ORION_LOGO, and KEY_ORION_BADGE

      • setKeyboardColor

        @OrionMethod
public static void setKeyboardColor(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                                  int... gKeys)
        Sets all of the keys on the keyboard color based on the specified image. This image should be used sparingly, as converting a BufferedImage to its scaled counterpart is very cost performant. This should only be called if you want to set the keyboard color based on an image rarely.
        Parameters:
        image - the image.
        gKeys - the colors that should be set for the G keys. The order of the keys goes: KEY_ORION_G1, KEY_ORION_G2, KEY_ORION_G3, KEY_ORION_G4, KEY_ORION_G5, KEY_ORION_G6, KEY_ORION_G9, KEY_ORION_G8, KEY_ORION_LOGO, and KEY_ORION_BADGE

      • createKeyboardBitmap

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage createKeyboardBitmap()
        Returns:
        a new BufferedImage of the TYPE_INT_ARGB type with the dimensions that an image would be resized to if it did not have the normal bitmap dimensions of a keyboard lighting layout.

      • flashKeyboardColor

        @OrionMethod
public static void flashKeyboardColor(int red,
                                                    int green,
                                                    int blue,
                                                    int duration,
                                                    int interval)
        Flashes all of the keys on the keyboard color based on the specified RGB, duration, and interval values.
        Parameters:
        red - the red.
        green - the green.
        blue - the blue.
        duration - how long the keys should flash.
        interval - how long the keys should stay lit and unlit.

      • pulseKeyboardColor

        @OrionMethod
public static void pulseKeyboardColor(int red,
                                                    int green,
                                                    int blue,
                                                    int duration,
                                                    int interval)
        Pulses all of the keys on the keyboard color based on the specified RGB, duration, and interval values.
        Parameters:
        red - the red.
        green - the green.
        blue - the blue.
        duration - how long the keys should pulse.
        interval - how long it should take for the keys to fade in to the specified color and fade back out.

      • pulseKeyboardColor

        @OrionMethod
public static void pulseKeyboardColor(int startRed,
                                                    int startGreen,
                                                    int startBlue,
                                                    int finishRed,
                                                    int finishGreen,
                                                    int finishBlue,
                                                    int duration,
                                                    boolean infinite)
        Pulses all of the keys on the keyboard color based on the specified RGB, duration, and interval values.
        Parameters:
        startRed - the red to start with.
        startGreen - the green to start with.
        startBlue - the blue to start with.
        finishRed - the red to end with.
        finishGreen - the green to end with.
        finishBlue - the blue to end with.
        duration - how long the keys should pulse.
        infinite - true if the keyboard keys should keep pulsing even after they've pulsed once.

      • pulseKeyboardColor

        infinite - true if the keyboard keys should keep pulsing even after they've pulsed once.

        @OrionMethod
public static void stopKeyboardEffects()
        Resets all of the keyboard effects and restores the keyboard colors.

        Parameters:

      • excludeKeysFromBitmap

        @OrionMethod
public static void excludeKeysFromBitmap(KeyboardKey... keys)
        Excludes the specified keys from the being modified when using the bitmap based setKeyboardColor() methods.
        Parameters:
        keys - the keys to exclude.
